page.title: 16FARM SHOPS ON LONGTON MOSS
page.content: On Longton Moss are some{farm shops which sell greengroceries and plants. Customers drive into the farm-yards and buy garden products from the greenhouses or surrounding flower beds and seed boxes. Fruit and other produce is kept inside an old farm building and purchased there for the comfort of shoppers, particularly in winter. {Eggs}are often on sale at the farms,and are also sold wholesale to shops and retailers in the towns. Cracked eggs go for food processing. There are large battery houses in this area. Other farms have 'free range' hens. Most people who call at these shops buy their eggs by the tray, which contains two and a half dozen eggs. Prices depend on the size of the eggs and are about 5 pence cheaper per dozen than the normal shop prices.
